channel.title: NYT > Sports

item.title: Mets 9, Phillies 8: Beltrán Sends Mets Home Tired, but Happy
item.description: The Mets came back from four- and three-run deficits, tying the score in the eighth inning, before Carlos Beltrán swatted a game-winning homer in the 16th inning to defeat the Phillies.
item.author: BEN SHPIGEL

item.title: Yankees 7, Red Sox 5: Yankees Build a Cushion, and the Bullpen Uses It
item.description: The Yankees have no answer for the fearsome duo of David Ortiz and Manny Ramírez; playing the Red Sox has become a matter of surviving their inevitable damage.
item.author: TYLER KEPNER

item.title: Heat 91, Pistons 86: In Rematch Against Detroit, Heat Takes Game 1
item.description: The Miami Heat served notice that its formula for dethroning the Detroit Pistons, the two-time defending conference champions, might be the right one.
item.author: JOHN ELIGON

item.title: Oilers 5, Mighty Ducks 4: Edmonton Inches Closer to Stanley Cup Finals
item.description: Fernando Pisani and the Edmonton Oilers are one victory away from the Stanley Cup finals. Pisani's goal helped the Oilers withstand a late rally by the Anaheim Mighty Ducks, and Edmonton won Game 3 of the Western Conference finals.
item.author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Players N.F.L. Banished Find Refuge in Canada
item.description: American players have moved to the Canadian Football League, which does not have mandatory drug testing.
item.author: JOHN BRANCH

item.title: Bulls Get No. 2 Pick, Thanks to the Knicks
item.description: The reward for the worst Knicks season in 20 years was officially claimed by the Chicago Bulls — in the form of the second overall pick in the June draft.
item.author: HOWARD BECK
